conclusion: Analyze forces on the ball when voltage is applied.
The small ball falls vertically under gravity with no initial horizontal force. Plates are separated by distance d.
The only force acting on the ball without voltage is gravity, G, acting vertically downward.
When voltage U is applied, an electric field E is created between the plates.
The electric field E is given by E = U/d.
The electric force on the ball is Fe = qE, where q is the charge on the ball.
Substituting E, we get Fe = qU/d.
Ball's motion changes to direction BC at a 45Â° angle to the vertical.
Horizontal and vertical components of the resultant force are equal.
Vertical force is G (gravity), horizontal force is Fe = qU/d.
Since forces are equal, G = qU/d.
Rearrange equation to solve for q: q = Gd/U.
